topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b4602e6368727a9e740700#post_54b4602e6368727a9e740700
Nah; extremist dogmatic thinking is the way to go.

I don't get upset whenever someone says they don't like Touhou cause I understand that a lot of people don't like franchises with a lot of good characters and instead like franchises with only a couple characters; also that I understand that a lot of people don't like positive role models with deep backgrounds and instead like anti-heroes or emotionally scarred individuals and heroes instead with emotional problems or instead heroes that left them as emotionally traumatized individuals who can't function in everyday situations to which Touhou has 0 of these and that the franchise doesn't offer what they want.  I also understand that a lot of people seem to hate music intensive games for whatever reason that I don't understand.  If someone dislikes it then that's their own thing.

topics.body: Why is it that I find the Precure series similar to the Gundam series?
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b464f56368727b6f670400#post_54b464f56368727b6f670400
I was being serious dude; a lot of complaints about Touhou that aren't about the art style are most of the time "I don't like music intensive games" or "I don't like characters that are that happy" or "there's too many characters" or "there's too much lore".  I legitimately don't get why people seem to hate games with that much music or such in it cause music is awesome dude and I just don't get why people want games without that much music.  I don't get why people don't like characters that are happy.  I don't get why people dislike franchises that feature happy characters, I don't get why people dislike games featuring good people, I don't get why people hate music in games; I legitimately don't get the reasons why people hate this sort of thing in games.

To me I like video games about good people; I like games with music; I like video games where the hero chooses the right decision and that's my personal preference; if someone doesn't like those sorts of things then okay, I'm just saying I don't get why people don't and that's okay.  If someone hates music in video games that's their personal preference; as for me I *LOVE* music, I just don't get why people hate music in games or such. 95% of the time in real life I always have headphones on and constantly listening to music; music is my life man, I legitimately don't understand the people that dislike music cause I *LOVE* music, they have the right to dislike music but I don't why some people hate music.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b46434636872790e470200#post_54b46434636872790e470200
I admit that Naruto's fanbase is stupid, But you're acting like they're all like that.

I really don't like being angry. (I don't like legitimately hurting others, Why did I ever think that was a good idea?)
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b4668063687278a5970800#post_54b4668063687278a5970800

Because according to the charts, jaded viewpoints of life and badly applied cynism/nihlism say no such a thing as good people who want to genuinely help others out of selflesness exist.

There's always an ulterior motive, there's no other way, anything else is just a lie people live. That's the absolute truth.

Music has always been a gray area, same as humour. That's free will and freedom of speech. For every person that says something is awesome, there has to be someone who says it's crap. No matter how stupid it is.

I personally don't mind it, cause it's necessary. Now are there people who take it to extremes? Of course, like anything in life.

I think MLP should take such route.

topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b46822636872707a040700#post_54b46822636872707a040700
I mean, instead of just this one series of the Mane 6 we're familiar with. Why not feature different sets of characters heroes and villains in different anime arcs? FiM has already become somewhat of a "Magical Girl" franchise.

Example
-MLP Friendship is Magic.
-MLP Rainbow Lights
-MLP Eternal Hearts
-MLP Symphony of _something_
-MLP Destiny
-MLP Stars of Light 

etc.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b467706368727792b50300#post_54b467706368727792b50300
There's a problem with this mentality; there's no such thing as absolute truth.  I have met people who legitametly are good individuals and I have seen some shit man.  When you get down to it people are fundamentally good; even in the darkest shit imaginable there are still good people that you just need to see.  Good people are all around you just need to see them; it's just if you vision is blurry the world isn't blurry you just need glasses.

If anything whenever things are bad is when good people shine the brightest cause they will do anything and everything in their power to carry along others to safety even knowing full well that it would be better in their own self interest to drop you.
